How very sad! I'm so sorry.

~Debi

-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, May 28, 2003 9:40:31 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bunny 911

In a message dated 5/28/2003 6:45:35 PM Eastern Standard Time,
cheeps4u@... writes:


> Poor bun bun....shock must have got it :( <<

One of our dogs brought home a baby bunny in it's mouth (didn't hurt it at
all) and dropped it at our feet. We "nursed it for a few days and it was
doing
great! Then one night, we heard crunching....one of the cats opened the
cage
and got it...we were so sad!! :o(

Nancy

>
>

messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Sara" <cheeps4u@y...>
wrote:
> Mix some alcohol and water with a little soap and try to pour it
> over the leg, wrap it or sew it shut or staple it. Is it bledding
> badly or just split?
>
>


it's hindleg was pretty skinned, but not bleeding. It died while i
was getting directions to a wildlife rescue....thanks for the help ;*(

ang

messages.subject: Re: Bunny 911
messages.msgSnippet: Mix some alcohol and water with a little soap and try to pour it over the leg, wrap it or sew it shut or staple it. Is it bledding badly or just split? ... got
messages.messageBody:
Mix some alcohol and water with a little soap and try to pour it
over the leg, wrap it or sew it shut or staple it. Is it bledding
badly or just split?


--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "unolist" <unolist@a...>
wrote:
> my 10yo just brought in an injured adult cottontail rabbit, a dog
got
> it and now it's back leg has exposed muscle. WHAT DO I DO?
>
> going to call the local wildlife office, can anyone else suggest
> anything ASAP?
>
> ang

messages.messageBody:
my 10yo just brought in an injured adult cottontail rabbit, a dog got
it and now it's back leg has exposed muscle. WHAT DO I DO?

going to call the local wildlife office, can anyone else suggest
anything ASAP?

ang
